comments.body: This is a reasonable group name, but is there any discussion of this in a KEP or proposal that I can ready?  Or just adhoc PR discussion?

I'm afraid that most of this PR is based on adhoc discussions, where it was discovered that a new API group will be necessary.
I believe https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/61599#issuecomment-375711161 is the first mention of that API group name.
@smarterclayton is there something I can do right now to improve the situation so that the way this is going is clearer?

`<component>.config.k8s.io` was the pattern settled on in https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/keps/sig-cluster-lifecycle/0014-20180707-componentconfig-api-types-to-staging.md#timeframe-and-implementation-order

the `apiserver.config.k8s.io` group was used for a parallel use case of an [admission-related config file](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/staging/src/k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/admission/plugin/webhook/config/apis/webhookadmission/v1alpha1/register.go#L24-L25) that any generic apiserver could consume
